website_summaries.verdict: The Trendnet TEW-812DRU is the most affordable 802.11ac-enabled router on the market, and it offers excellent performance.
pros: The Trendnet TEW-812DRU AC1750 Dual Band Wireless Router offers excellent Wi-Fi performance and ease of use at a low cost
cons: There's no wall-mounting option and the router's USB plugged-in storage performance is slow

customer_reviews.title: Drop connection, DNS problem
customer_reviews.text: DOOONN'TTT BUUUYYYY. I've had this thing for about 1.5 years now. For several months now, my wifi connection would just randomly drop. I get the "DNS could not be found" way too often and a few seconds, "no internet." Sometimes it happens up to 10-15 times a day. I've read other reviews with people having the same issue. I would have to constantly disconnect and reconnect to the wifi. Unplugging the router and plugging it back in doesn't help. AAAHHHHHHHHHHH!! I never have this issue when I'm at school, friends' places, or other coffee shops. But home, the god damn router is a piece of crap. Doesn't matter how close I am to it. -_-
customer_reviews.author: jennycakes

customer_reviews.title: It was problematic until...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router several months ago to replace an older N router. I installed it as I normally would, but the connection kept dropping randomly. After several troubleshooting attempts, I stopped using It and went back to my dependable old router. Last week I decided to give it another try. This time, however, I searched the support website for a firmware update and installed the latest one. I then installed it as usual and it has been running without issues for several days. The signal is strong on both bands and I am now very happy with this purchase. I would rate it 5 stars save for the initial issues. Hopefully this helps some of you with similar issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonista

customer_reviews.title: Used to be a fan of trendnet, no longer
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for four years and has been great. My issue here is that I'm no networking expert but it appears I have to be now since technical support is no longer supported for this product. You can imagine how shocked I was when I tried to call technical support and was given the news, then shamelessly sold, or attempted rather, some 6 month long tech support. Really poor customer service management. I used to be a fan, and rave about my product to people, but no longer. Shame on Trednet. All I needed was help identifying a printer IP address on my network.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton L.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the wi-fi performance in a 1500 sq
customer_reviews.text: When I received the TEW-812 DRU v2.1 router, the firmware was 4 generations old. The updates required 4 chronologically applied firmware updates found at "Download.TRENDnet.com". The detailed instructions for the updates worked well. Very pleased with the wi-fi performance in a 1500 sq. ft. ranch. The router is located in the basement, not an ideal location, 2' below the ceiling, and 40' away from the point-of-use. The hard-wired devices perform flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Bob The Toolman

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with the latest beta dd-wrt firmware (2017-02-28 r31544).
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I got mine, I flashed it with the latest beta DD-WRT. At the time, it was 2017-02-28 r31544. Specifically, trendnet-812dru-webflash-31544.bin was used to flash. I see they have a newer one, but well, you know what they say, if it ain't broke, don't fix it. One surprising thing I saw is that it's made in Taiwan, not China. I have no idea if this is true with every single unit.
customer_reviews.author: R. H. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Horrific Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this thing for a while and managed but it is time for a new one. I can't take it any longer. I can only connect certain things to it, my mobile devices connect and that is about it. My desktop and printer have never been able to connect via wireless connection. It will always say the password is wrong. TV won't connect as well. The strength sucks, I will literally be on my porch, 10 feet away and it will disconnect because of a wall. So either the wall is made of reinforced steel and concrete or this thing is just a horrible piece of plastic. You can decide.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this router, when it works. Great features (e.g. multiple WiFi networks each on their own VLAN), but the unit I received would "lockup" either after making several configuration adjustments or after several hours of use. Reading reviews here from others who had similar problems I tried to troubleshoot things like configuration of attached hardware and DNS conflicts, but the freeze ups continued and I had to unplug/replug to get the router to work. Three stars because when it does work this router has great range and throughput and I might have just received a "lemon." However, I have returned this unit and opted for a different brand of router.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E

customer_reviews.title: One star off for set up instructions
customer_reviews.text: Unit seems to be working well although I am surprised that the signal strength indicator shows fewer bars than the old linksys I replaced. Setup would be tough for the uninitiated. Many fields to fill in with no guidance on the setup web site. I still have questions even though I get through it because of experience.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Wifi Router
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st wifi router and I was very impressed. Connects to my Galaxy J7 Pro no problem, I got this for my smartphone and for guests. I like the pre-encryption, fast speeds, how it's got a nat firewall, and how you can hook up 4 other Ethernet cables. Personally I'm not a fan of wifi due to effects of EMF so I turn it off when I don't need my android but for a newbie this thing rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E.

customer_reviews.title: Flawless, clear interface and the SPEED is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: This WiFi Router is amazing. 2 desktops, 3 laptops, 3 smart tvs, PS4, Xbox, WiiU, 4 smart phones with a 100Mbs internet connection, really opened up the pipe for all the internet access items in a big way. FUlly allowed all the systems to access max speed from the internet pipe. SMooth setup, very configurable, provides information on your network in a very clear interface. Has deep advanced settings for the more detailed person but also has easy settings for the regular person. 20 minutes to set everything up and bagn...managed everything flawlessly. Even used the MU-MiMo connection and saw a massive improvement in latency and speed. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Bar

customer_reviews.title: For the price I'm really happy!
customer_reviews.text: PLEASE GET JANUARY 2015 FIRMWARE UPDATE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! IT FIXES THE INTERNET DISCONNECT ISSUE. Changed my rating to 5 stars after update. The dual band works well with my modern and ancient devices like old printers. Only 2 things that are sorta negative: 1. The USB port at the back. The transfer speeds are abysmal. I hardly use that though. 2. The lights on the front sometimes don't light up to indicate internet, lan or 2.4 or 5ghz frequencies when they are indeed working. But again that's minor. I wish I could turn off all the lights especially at nights when I want to get some sleep. Still its an excellent product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dre876

customer_reviews.title: Very good after Firmware Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Works very good with it upgraded to the latest firmware version. Before upgrading it was so slow that I was going to return the item. But now it operates at about 75% the speed for my other wireless router for reading and writing files to an attached HDD. It is actually faster on wifi connections, but before wifi was slow. Download the upgrade to make this router a better deal. Wired connection copies files at greater than 110 MBs (Megabytes a second). Far better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: K Guillory

customer_reviews.title: TrendNet AC1750 Drops internet connection.
customer_reviews.text: This router constantly drops network connection. I contacted my ISP and upgraded the old cable modem thinking that was the issue and in the process updated the bandwidth speed too. But unfortunately that did resolve the issue. I then downloaded the latest firmware update from TrendNet and that did NOT fix the issue. This is frustrating and I will need to deal with it until I can purchase another router and sorry TrendNet but I don't believe I will be buying my replacement router from you. When it does stay connected it is fast. But having to reboot the router has become a nuisance. I lost $124.99 buying this, very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Randomly and constantly drops connections during use
customer_reviews.text: Randomly drops connections. Even after a firmware update. Really thought highly of this item after paying 99$ for it and hooking it up to see the smoking speed and extra range it offered over my old netgear N router. However it drops connections constantly and randomly and I am unable to figure out why even after updating the firmware. The company site itself has a link to the updated firmware and i tried with 3 different browsers to download it. Button to download doesn't even work. I found it on softpedia instead. Cnet raved about this router but obviously did not spend enough time with it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K

customer_reviews.title: Not worth more than the ten bucks I paid for this
customer_reviews.text: If I had paid more for this router, I would have rated this one or two stars depending on how much more I paid. After more than a year, the 5 Ghz radio stopped working and I have to live with only 2.4 Ghz WiFi. I'm not that disappointed since I only paid $10 for this. This router needs to be rebooted regularly. I wrote a script to reboot it everyday when no one's using the internet so I'm not that worried about it. I'll probably avoid buying future TRENDnet products unless they are significantly discounted.
customer_reviews.author: Admiral Juan

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well for the price. Distributed dual-band wireless ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for the price. Distributed dual-band wireless to my apartment admirably, although it occasionally had issues getting signal to the kitchen. It also occasionally fought with my Comcast-provided modem. I saw intermittent signal drops, but it was very difficult to determine whether it was the modem or router's fault. Eventually replaced this with a Black Friday discounter premium router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Dreadful Product. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely dreadful product and customer service. I have Comcast blast where I was getting 50 megs per second and as soon as I put this in it dropped to .54. It was unbelievable. I called trendnet and spent two hours on the phone updating firmware, trying to reorganize and speak to a representative. Truth be told wasn't mad at her. The product is garbage and I would urge every shopper to beware. Not sure how this got on PCMAGs Editor Choice but it doesnt work at all. I am returning it tomorrow and looking elsewhere since I determined it was the router itself because I hooked my comcast modem/router combo back up and not a single hiccup.
customer_reviews.author: mgroman

customer_reviews.title: Reboot lots more often after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Poor signal for 5GHz from the beginning. Performance's gone worse after a year. Sometimes it went completely offline for a day or two. I've experienced more down time after that. No matter what i could do to improve its performance. I've upgraded to the latest fw, custom fw, changed settings, moved to different locations, etc. It didn't help much. To the point i had to purchase another AC router to cover the house (2500sqft) entirely and in case it goes down temporarily. I wondered lack of external antennas caused the poor signal strength.
customer_reviews.author: Ben N

customer_reviews.title: Firmware upgrade solved my issues
customer_reviews.text: I have been experiencing 30% packet loss issues (using `ping google.com` from Terminal) over the past 6 months while simultaneously streaming Youtube or other video, and for the longest time I thought it was our ISP. This issue would come and go, and my wife was experiencing terrible reliability as well, and frequently our connections would just hang. I finally noticed the issue did not occur when wired directly to the router. It wasn't long before I found the firmware upgrade menu in the router configuration. After upgrading the last firmware, v2.1.2.0 (Oct 2, 2015), all my issues have disappeared. Zero packet loss, consistent latency. For anyone else suffering from connection reliability issues, try upgrading the firmware first!
customer_reviews.author: Ian Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a couple years. Worked great. Had a lightening strike close to the house a few weeks back, and the internet connection was lost. I replaced it with a Linksys EA6400 AC1600 Dual Band Smart Wi-Fi Router. The Linksys was extremely easy to set up, but it cannot hold a candle the the TRENDnet when it comes to range, speed, and multiple users. You never know how good something is until you lose it and try to replace it. I bought this a couple days ago from Amazon. It was delivered yesterday. I set it up last night. My wife is taking the Linksys back to the store today.
customer_reviews.author: jerk

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a few days, then went to H E double hockey sticks.
customer_reviews.text: This router was somewhat easy to set up (could have been a little easier) but then it would stop working about once a day. I had to turn it off again and on again to get it to work. I'm pretty computer savvy, but not when it comes to routers or modems, so I thought it was maybe something on my end. However, with no other changes to my computer or network, it started freezing more than once a day. Seeing as the router it replace locked up maybe three times its entire life cycle, I decided to return this one back to Amazon. I went with the EW-7208APC AC750 instead and it's been two weeks and working flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: K. Costa

customer_reviews.title: The best router I have had
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best routers I have ever had. Very easy to configure and with a lot of options. I am personally a geek and I have found this router to cover all my requirements. There was just one issue after I upgraded one of my laptops to Windows 10 that made me restart the router every time I put my laptop to sleep. But I found out that leaving the channel band size fixed would solve my problem (one feature not available in all routers). I also like to update my devices frequently and there are several Firmware releases available for this device.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Jaramillo

customer_reviews.title: Great Router For Heavy Usage
customer_reviews.text: I have used this router for a couple of years and have never had any problems with it. The encryption is easy to set up. It is still the latest technology: Dual Band Gigabit, AC, and I really like the guest network option. The 2.4g has decent range. The 5.0g is for close rage only, heavy streaming. I have heavy internet usage: two phone lines (VOIP), fax line, cell phones, streaming video (Netflix, Amazon etc.), and computers. It handles it all without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for flakey routers. Don't need to be a nerd to install.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very rapidly, sooner than expected. Was easy to set up - you must use the setup disc which is not clear from the instructions. I have 2 password protected wireless channels (2.4 and 5 My) and 2 unprotected public channels. This route replaces 2 flakey routers which routinely dropped the signal throughout the day. So far (after 6 weeks) it has performed flawlessly. My only complaint is the signal strength is no stronger than the routers its replacing. It's located in a stairwell between floors. The signal is fine within the house, but declines rapidly as I move away outside on our identity deck.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I really hate giving bad reviews, but I call 'em as I see 'em, and this router isn't worth the time or money to order. I sent mine back without hesitation. If you want slow speeds and unreliable connections, this might be for you. If on the other hand, you want a good router that can handle lots of bandwidth and still give great speeds, do NOT get this router.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: There are cheaper models that do a better or as good job
customer_reviews.text: Due to its rating on several websites, i replaced my $20 TPLink with this, but it's not worth the extra cost. Wifi still drops now and then, more than with the TPLink. The AC band is actually more unstable than the N band, i thought AC was supposed to be less interference prone. Couldn't get the USB to work, i'm sure it's me but if i can't figure out how to use it, i'd think other average users will be frustrated as well. You shouldn't need IT support to use home products, is my view.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: HUGE DISAPOINTMENT
customer_reviews.text: This is the most troublesome router I have ever purchased..It's wireless signal barely reaches 30 feet...I don't have cinder block walls for it to penetrate through...The signal only has to make one left turn to reach the main part of my home..The strength bottoms out to 1 bar at 39 feeet and is zero at 42 feet....I am receiving a stronger signal from my neighbors Att combination wireless modem through my home which is 50 feet away from his router modem...Re positioning the TRENDnet does nothing to improve the signal...I'll contact Amazon about a refund..too bad..
customer_reviews.author: wcopeland38

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade to my really old router.
customer_reviews.text: It was all of 3 days before I caved in and installed DD-WRT. I was not a fan of the constant saving the interface that comes with it had. I have used DD-WRT for years, so I was familiar with it. I wanted a little more WiFi coverage, and DD-WRT allows you to increase transmission strength. There were a few resets needed. I took a star since once you install DD-WRT its no longer supported, I have been mildly disappointed with the 5 GHZ range, and the WiFi coverage out of the box was not so great. Overall, it has been great. Everything has been wonderfully faster.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Great item. Been using for a couple months now ...
customer_reviews.text: Great item. Been using for a couple months now and love it. Took awhile for me, a non techie to figure out how to integrate into my satellite system, but once done working flawlessly. Only difficulty is though our home is only 900 square ft, it's signal drops off quickly from one end to next. Old router easily covered entire 4000 sq ft home and entire property. Already had to purchase signal booster for iPhones, don't want to have to purchase another for this. Seems good quality, fast service, could have used an you tube prep on set up.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN W. EVANS

customer_reviews.title: I can not recommend this router
customer_reviews.text: While this is a screaming fast router, the web admin and setup is odd and hard to understand. I had the same "internet connection dropping" issues that everyone else seems to be having. If you have mostly wired connections and maybe 1 or wifi connections this might work well for you but I have over a dozen and this router definitely can't handle multiple wifi devices. It just locks up and needs a power reboot. I returned it immediately. Amazon, you guys rock. Thanks for making the return so incredibly easy and fast!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff b.

customer_reviews.title: Defective or didn't work - not sure
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as we have many electronics in our house that require WIFI and our old wireless wasn't cutting it. Read the reviews and thought this would be great. Connection dropped after minutes. Had to keep reconnecting and the kids never even realized so ate up data off their phones. After spending hours trying to figure out and consulting with other people figured it was just a bad router. No problem sending it back but had to do a late night Walmart run and pick up something I didn't want just to have internet.
customer_reviews.author: Shelyn

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and easy to configure
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this for a client, and its setup couldn't have been simpler. No software needed to install, which makes installs easier and faster than the older models. Just open the website that comes with the paperwork, and start configuring. VERY IMPORTANT: his model has two distinct signals to connect to. Some routers just combine them into one signal, but this one does not. The only thing to remember with this is to configure BOTH the 2.4 AND the 5ghz signals. Give them the same password, and your life will get easier when you're frantically trying to connect to either network signal.
customer_reviews.author: ProNewsPhotog

customer_reviews.title: Superfast champion.  Strong signals for your tech.
customer_reviews.text: Superfast. Somewhat basic settings, but superfast. I had a problem with my main laptop, but didn't know if it was the router or the wifi. It was the wifi, but my router- although nothing was wrong with it, the router was the limiting factor for my Chromecast and media streamers. Since we moved from a 1950's home to a 2000's home, the signal got better, but the internal router speed did not change. The internal speeds made all the difference. ALL THE DIFFERENCE. Great price point. No more router saturation!
customer_reviews.author: mousepotato

customer_reviews.title: I constantly have to reset the router for a better wireless connection and half the time the 5ghz band ...
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this router for almost 2 years now, but it's capability has been quickly diminishing. I constantly have to reset the router for a better wireless connection and half the time the 5ghz band can't be read. It used to work great up until about 3 months ago. Time to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Sioma Family

customer_reviews.title: I decided to give it a try and am very happy. So far its performing very well and is ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews on PC magazine, this router was the editors choice for 2014 and came with praise. I decided to give it a try and am very happy. So far its performing very well and is fast. For the money, I'm not sure you can do much better. Besides having fast wifi, it has USB sharing which is nice. I hooked up my 1 TB external hard drive with all my movies on it. This allows devices such as TV's to connect to the network and access the movies on the hard drive for streaming. There is no need to mess around with DVD's Blue Rays, and players any more. Use this and upgrade to a full digital library.
customer_reviews.author: Product Reviews International

customer_reviews.title: not great, for about 7 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Worked Ok, not great, for about 7 weeks, then just died. I never thought it was noticably faster than the 5 yr old router I was replacing. Very disappointing. Update 1: I contacted technical support to create a ticket. Their response: the hardware is likely faulty; pay to ship it back to us so we can look at it. Concerning the speed question: my old router was g; the oldest wireless adapter I use now is n (some are ac). This router was not noticably faster, and the range was similar--maybe a 10 foot increase at best.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great value (bought for $19
customer_reviews.text: Great value (bought for $19.99 before Xmas) given dual band and guest network capability. Using in a relatively small house, but range is good enough to work in all rooms on main floor level and also in basement, although range is better for 2.4 GHz than for 5 Ghz (as expected). Works as expected. Friend of mine also has this router and it has lasted over a year so far with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Meticulous

customer_reviews.title: Horrible router--constantly drops connection, just like others' experience
customer_reviews.text: This router seemed to be working for the first 35 days--just enough time for the return period to pass. Then...constantly dropping wi-fi. Every. Single. Day. After six calls to Trendnet in which we have updated the firmware, checked to make sure the wired connection was working (it was, just not wireless), changing settings and frequency, plugging computer directly into modem, lather, rinse, repeat; still not working. Finally we reach a "Level 3 Technician" who tells us they can't refund our money. Two months of frustration and everyone maxing out their data plans on their phones due to lack of wifi. Done. We are done with Trendnet. Save yourself time and frustration. Don't buy this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Nicole

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box it would not give any computer an IP address. I was connected with a brand new ethernet cable that was working moments before on my old router. I tried pressing the reset button on the unit to set it to factory condition but it did not seem to do anything. I tried repeatedly to restart and reset the router, my computer, my cable modem, my ethernet connection in varying order but nothing helped. This was my first and probably my last time trying TrendNet products.
customer_reviews.author: Critical Thinker

customer_reviews.title: Worked ok for awhile, but I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. They worked fine for a year and a half, I had one setup as my primary router and the other as one of my access points. After that, the primary router lost wireless ability, though I connected via wire ok. I reset, updated firmware, reset all wireless settings, reset again, etc., still no fix. I replaced it with the other I was using as an access point router. Now I am trying to make the primary an access point again, but it will not let me change its IP. Again, have reset, updated firmware, etc., tried various things. It's very frustrating, I am disappointed with the performance of these routers.
customer_reviews.author: Tay D

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the device
customer_reviews.text: I'm not real computer savvy and required help from their techs to get everything plugged in correctly. And once I entered the info all my devices (laptop, blu Ray etc 'popped ' in.... all wirelessly. EXCEPT I forgot to ask about my wireless printer and had trouble with that. I called the tech folks back and they 'politely' offered to get that connected for $39.95 or perhaps I'd like to buy a 1-2 year program for $150+ to cover any tech help needed. That really turned me off. I like the device and I got a friend to get my printer working ... just beware of their after sale tactics.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: I love this router and for the price it's great
customer_reviews.text: I love this router and for the price it's great. I thought about getting a newer AC1900 model but that only increases the theoretical 802.11n speed which I don't really use or care about. Easy to use and very fast. As for range, I think it's pretty good. I use a Linksys Wireless-AC Universal Media Connector (WUMC710) to connect. It's about 35 feet away, around the corner with the kitchen between the router and connector, and I get about half of my 300 Mbps internet bandwidth from the connector. Which is perfect for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: jared harris

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and screaming FAST!!
customer_reviews.text: We replaced a rather old router that was beginning to fail with this one. We have had this new Trendnet router for about a month and there have been no problems. Not only is the router speed fast, but devices connect to it very quickly. The router itself is a bit large (probably due to the dual band internal antennas) and the styling is minimal (not ugly but not a work of art either). Getting the unit set up to operate on a single band was supper easy, but there is little documentation and setting up advanced functions will require a bit more technical know-how.
customer_reviews.author: Ramblin Wreck

customer_reviews.title: ) but this one sucked. I had it for less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I understand that routers sometimes need to reboot (power off and then on again, not hard reset,) but this one sucked. I had it for less than 3 months, and in that time I had to reboot it over a dozen times. To top it off, and the reason I'm even writing this review, is that I tried to make an update to the firmware... it then broke, and couldn't even be hard-reset. I submitted a support ticket, and that looked promising: quick response and all, but then it turns out that it's a hardware issue. So it's sitting right in front of me and the lights are on, but it's still not working. This sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Kline

customer_reviews.title: worked fine while it worked.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a factory refurb from through Amazon. It worked fine for about two weeks, and then would only run for a few hours at a time before resetting itself to the factory defaults, at which time it needed to be re-configured again. I gave up and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Drops connection and buzzes when transmitting over wifi.
customer_reviews.text: The wireless data transfer creates a buzzing sound that is bothersome. It is "supposedly" below the threshold of most people's hearing but I could still hear it. I replaced the original hoping that it was a bad capacitor or something, but I still have the same issue. I decided to do my best to ignore it in lieu of ordering another replacement. This was a bad decision as now it has started dropping all internet connections for a few seconds every 30 minutes or so. Unfortunately I am past the deadline for returning it or getting a refund. I would never buy another again and will most likely replace this device with a different brand in the very near future.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Poor wired speed..
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to upgrade a 4 year old D-Link and get the dual band capabilities. Setup interface is clumsy. Connecting my range extender was easy, however, most of the time, the signal was so low that the extender would drop the signal. The wired speed across my internal network using the wired ports showed a speed almost 1/2 of the speed I was getting from my D-Link. Never have had good results from Trendnet but thought I would give them another chance. Big mistake...
customer_reviews.author: Dragonspawn

customer_reviews.title: Poor Router
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with the AC1750. Several times a week I lose internet connectivity and/or wireless connectivity. The wireless connections are all within 60' of the router. I have upgraded the firmware to the Jan. 2015 2.0.10.0 which was supposed to fix the internet issue. I have made multiple attempts to contact the English technical support number and have been disconnected and left messages with no replies. Very poor service and a mediocre product for the price. I have an iMac connected via ethernet and a Macbook Pro connected wirelessly. The internet connection issue continues with both the ethernet and wireless connections.
customer_reviews.author: bobfishes

customer_reviews.title: After a few months...
customer_reviews.text: My old router was a D-link dual band gaming router, by no means a cheap one. For whatever reason it did not like my galaxy s-4 phone. This is a documented issue with that router. That router also required frequent reboots. I have been running this one for a few months now, and I have not have had to even think about it since I installed it. Works as advertised, it is reliable, puts out great signal. Set up and configuration was fairly easy, if you read the instructions. No problems there, either. Couldn't tell you about customer service, since I haven't had to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Smack

customer_reviews.title: Most complicated router I have ever set up.
customer_reviews.text: Claims easy 1,2,3 set up :/ Yeah I don't think so..... This Router was the most complicated router I have ever has the displeasure of setting up. Nor did it improve the signal in a two level home over 3000 sq. feet . It was so complicated that I had to have a friend that works in IT actually come over to my house to set it up! and for nothing seeing as the signal was simply so weak I ended up just giving it away.
customer_reviews.author: Vivadsanchez

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and configuration plus fast speeds
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this router today and it took less than ten minutes. It was delightfully easy to set up and configure. The use of the WPS feature allowed for easy set-up of many of the hardware items I had to connect to the new network and all went off without a hitch. I have definitely noticed an increase in speed over the 10-year old Linksys router I replaced :). I haven't configured a guest network yet but it appeared to be easy to do. So far, I would definitely recommend this product if you need a new router!
customer_reviews.author: J Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 10 months
customer_reviews.text: I have used this router for 10 months with very good results. This month the number 2 port stopped working. I have submitted a help ticket and was told by the technician to submit for an RMA. The support through Trendnet is ongoing and I will tell you how it works out when we finish. At this time I will have to give it a low rating, but, hope their support team performs well. If they back their product I will revise my rating. Stand by!
customer_reviews.author: Earl Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: The wireless is pretty flaky too
customer_reviews.text: This router won't let incoming VOIP calls through. I can talk on VOIP outgoing, but all incoming calls go to my VOIP provider's message service, and my phone never rings. I didn't have this problem with my old router. The wireless is pretty flaky too. ****** I was wrong. The voip incoming calls started working when I changed from one of the viatalk voip servers to another. The registration must have been partially (for incoming) lost when I inserted the new router; choosing a new one reestablished the connections. The wireless is still weak, so I raised the rating from one to three stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: I am pretty happy with this product but will be giving four ...
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty happy with this product but will be giving four stars for now. The reason for this is because the 2.4GHz channel works great near the router but works very poorly when in another room. This is quite confusing because the 5GHz channel has great strength and range throughout my appartment. I recently installed an Intel AC 7260 wireless card in my laptop which allows me to connect to the 5GHz band so this is not a huge problem. I will try to resolve this problem with the 2.4GHz band in the meantime and will post regarding this issue at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Herrin

customer_reviews.title: The unit itself functions fine.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router in May 2018 and Trendnet is not updating the software on the model V1.OR . The Version 2.XR is being updated . I think Trendnet should continue to support the older model . The unit itself functions fine .
customer_reviews.author: T. McNabb

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing performance that did not live up to the reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry to say that I was a bit disappointed. Various reviews (some of them professional reviewers) rated this router as fast and with a large range for its price. However, I found that it performs no better than - and often worse than - a five year old router I bought on the cheap at a box store. I had hoped this would solve some of the range issues in my home - five people using the internet in far flung parts of a two story home, but even with the router in the very center of the house there are range issues.
customer_reviews.author: Athelas

customer_reviews.title: TRENDnet router
customer_reviews.text: Once it is up and running it works wonderfully. It made an amazing difference in our internet speed. The "easy to set up" part wasn't so easy for the average clueless user. I followed the directions in the book several times but the magic screen to program the router never popped up. Well it turns out my laptop kept searching for the wireless connection, which wasn't there with the ethernet cable needed for the programming. Tech support wasn't much help. Our tech savvy friend came to the rescue and set things straight. So now we're happy.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy J.

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have many wired and wireless devices in the house. For years, I have used a Netgear router and hub, but I grew tired of rebooting the device because I would lose wireless connectivity or the wireless channels would be lost as my neighbors overtook my space. I did lots of researching on a replacement and settled on the TRENDnet router and hub because of a PC Week (or equivalent) editor's choice award. I am very pleased with my purchase. The TRENDnet has been very reliable and stable for all of my devices. I would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Bob916Stick

customer_reviews.title: Great range and signal for about 6 months............
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router in March and now it's Oct. I lose my wifi connection about every 10-15 mins. It sometimes comes back or i have to reset the router which is a huge pain! I have updated the firmware, which one of the fixes was supposed to be a more stable wifi, guess what, it is not. I can say that this router has not been worth the money in the long run. I have contacted the person who responds to this email and if they do something i will change my rating otherwise, buy a different brand as this one works for while and then quits working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good Router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router in Nov 2014. It initially worked great on both 2.4Ghz & 5GHz bands. After 4 months, the 5GHz band started to randomly drop out. I worked with their costumer service for a couple of months with different firmware and settings but this did not resolve the issue. I finally asked for a replacement under warranty, which they promptly agreed to (required me to pay the $10.50 return postage). The replacement router works great. This product was easy to set up and I was very impressed with the customer service responses. The 4 stars is for both the router and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Bob Mc

customer_reviews.title: How do I return this??
customer_reviews.text: This Router is still not working for me. How do I return it? I purchased this router in October and it worked well initially. Now my service drops out multiple times a day. I have been assured by Direct TV that my internet service is active and isn't the problem. The modem has also been replaced and is working fine. I have no idea how to fix the issue but I'm so frustrated. WiFi is always active but I am often unable to get onto the internet. Troubleshooting has failed completely. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: NL

customer_reviews.title: 4 Year Rating
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for just under (September) four years now. Overall, it has served its purpose, but the past year has seen frequent drops in signal and general spotiness. In a smaller space (~1000 sq ft or less), this router was pretty decent. Speeds weren't ever consistent compared to what the modem was outputting, but that can be said of many routers. Overall, for the price, not a bad value.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared for unstable wifi
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely useless - the router suffers random disconnection issue when using wifi on both 5G or 2.4G band. I have updated to the latest "official" DD-WRT firmware from Trendnet and still same behavior. The internal antenna is also a culprit for other wifi issues. Overall, very disappointing unit despite having DD-WRT support.
customer_reviews.author: ArminVanHousen

customer_reviews.title: Finally! My internet isn't so slow!
customer_reviews.text: For the longest time I cursed my internet provider for slow internet. Finally, I figured out it was our wireless router, not the provider, that was causing the problems. Although my "old" router was new and I was within the allotted number of devices using it, I found my internet was slow--but now, with TRENDnet, wow. Much faster. My favorite feature is the buffering. With my "old" router, I was streaming videos and the video would stop every 5 minutes to buffer. With TRENDnet, I no longer have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Puddleferry

customer_reviews.title: Great product and Support!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to upgrade both my Router and Cable Modem. I did my research and after reading many glowing reviews of different Routers decided on this one. After receiving it I found it paired well with my new cable modem. I initially had an issue installing it (fyi, I am not a novice) and called the number provided. I had a person answer my initial call and he walked me through a resolution quickly. It is because of this support that I did not lower my rating. It works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: JJdeadhead

customer_reviews.title: This is the very best!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Time Warner Gateway combination router and modem and selected this product after many hours of careful review. Like all things there were good reviews and bad ones. For me, I hit the jackpot. I am able to pick up signals for all of our smartphones clearly to the front patio, about 80 feet away thru walls! I am also running two computers, wired, and two Matricom GBox MX2 Android boxes, wired. This is a great product and I strongly recommend it for those who simply want the best, period!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Robert E. Champion

customer_reviews.title: Second wifi router for house
customer_reviews.text: Our second wifi router was a replacement for an older, less expensive model. The TrendNet was easy to hook-up and get running. The instructions were cryptic but manageable - they left me in a spot that was confusing but once I realized I needed to go to the TrendNet website things got brighter. We were hoping to increase our wifi range enough to set on the back porch - didn't make it. The range of routers seem to be quite inflated by the manufacters. Overall, we feel we made an improvement in speed for our iPad which makes us happy. Parting advice - do your research before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: ToadKing

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product after reading the good reviews. It would loose connections multiple times a day and I would have to reinstall the drivers and ips again each time. It would even lose the hard wired connection to my pc. The software had very few options compared to Netgear. And the design was very unstable. I would not recommend this to anyone. I went and got a Netgear R6300 and for a couple more dollars I got an amazing piece of equipment that I have had no issues with and the options are out of this world!
customer_reviews.author: buckeye26

customer_reviews.title: Good at First -- Progressively Worse Over Time; Became Useless
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay at first, then the wifi quality slowly started to degrade, until all bars went away (even when right next to it). Over time, this slowly degraded to it losing signal every few hours -- it got to the point where I could not work from home for 8 hours straight without having to reboot it -- while missing several minutes of a VOIP conference call. I see other people have had similar issues -- AVOID this router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked awesome for a week.
customer_reviews.text: But I needed this for more than a week. After a week, the range and bandwidth dropped considerably with no explanation. I hadn't enable automatic firmware update, so that didn't break it. No one lives near me, so it wasn't interference. Per online support I updated firmware, I rebooted, I completely reset the device. Has not improved. I may or may not go through the hassle of returning it, but I am using a different router now.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy Stintz

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: At first this router seemed to perform well - range and transfer speeds were great. The 5Ghz band sometimes dropped connections, but that's just how things are with 5Ghz. Unfortunately, after about 6 months of use, the router suddenly started having problems, both wireless and LAN clients are affected. It has to be reset at least once a day to work properly. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BoostedZ

customer_reviews.title: Totally Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: This router is junk. I have had to reset it at least 2-3 times a month and I have no wifi service on the second floor of my house. Now my house is only a 2000 sq ft. 2 story home. I never had this problem before. I would not recommend this unit to anyone. What kills me is it got really good ratings. Very disappointed. I tried to send it back but I was one day past the return policy with Amazon so I am stuck with it. Next time I will go to Best Buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Magicman

customer_reviews.title: Worry free wireless router
customer_reviews.text: When I had a power surge that wiped out my TRENDnet Wireless AC1750 Dual Band Gigabit Router with USB 3.0 Share Port, Pre-Encrypted, TEW-812DRU I purchased a new one and plugged it in and it never missed a lick!
customer_reviews.author: Virgil K. Harville, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good product when it's working. Bad QC/Service/Company.
customer_reviews.text: About 6-12 months after the purchase it just died. No power. After a few weeks I plugged it back in and it worked. Now, just after the warranty is up it did it again. I tested it with a different power plug and it works. So, it was a faulty power plug. TrendNet will not send me a new one, and even if the warranty was still good their RMA process looks absolutely dauntingly dreadful. And you have to pay for shipping. Great product, but terrible QC and warranty. Now I have to find and buy a new power plug somewhere. Probably NOT through TrendNet.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Warren

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased TrendNet products in the past and have ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased TrendNet products in the past and have had a lot of success. This product is quite the opposite. The wired connections work as advertised. However, the wireless (both 2.4 and 5G) drop out sporadically, The firmware was dated as delivered. I updated the firmware but that did not help the wireless problem. There is simply no reliable wireless connectivity with this device. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: A very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the TRENDnet TEW-812DRU Version 2.1 via Amazon.com Prime service and received my product in exactly 2 days. Once receiving the product, I read some online articles about disabling your ISP router and only using your WiFi-router to secure your online usage. Somehow I also enabled my Open Unsecured Public WiFi enabling unrestricted access. Oh-oh. I called tech support, the tech support representative was very professional and understanding of my issue. He verified my secured access while helping me disable my Open unsecured access to those driving by wanting to use my WiFi at my expense. Tech support is open 24/7 ready to help and assist all my needs, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: South Gate Pack N Ship

customer_reviews.title: I should wait to post a review
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Works perfectly out of the box. However, with a lot of reviews that deal with electronics its always better to post a review after about six months or so, because this is usually when things start to go wrong with them. As for now, it works great, and I get coverage everywhere in my house(ranch style). I was a little worried about it not having external antenna(s), because I thought they would get better range, but it gets the job done and my speeds are matching what I pay for through Time Warner.
customer_reviews.author: Jill J Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Tech support was also very poor when I contacted them
customer_reviews.text: Router works ok, but upnp ducks so you have to manually configure any port forwarding needed. The biggest issue though is that whenever there is a firmware update you have to reset to factory defaults. What this means is setting up the port forwards again because the UPNP doesn't work, and also setting up an dgcp reservations again. Tech support was also very poor when I contacted them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Walter

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.text: Have gone through two of these now. Even grounded, with all attachments going through a UPS this is still the only piece of hardware that dies after a storm (router uplink to modem stops working). Was able to chock the first one up to bad luck, but two in a row to the exact same problem with no other hardware affected? Not making this mistake of buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Mello

customer_reviews.title: Started well but ending badly
customer_reviews.text: Like many others I have become very dissatisfied with this product. Worked fine for a couple months then started dropping internet connection and loading page's take longer and longer as systems are getting slower and slower. In my research I have found this to be a common problem. Each morning I must unplug router then plug it back in. This was highly recommend by PC magazine. I an not given to returning products after using then for a couple months but I an tempted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Problems from the beginning and very limited technical support
customer_reviews.text: I have a older Trendnet (633) that is great and wanted to upgrade, so I went with the Trendnet TEW-812, AC1750. Problems from the beginning with dropping WIFI. Also, wireless Roku couldn't find it so I upgraded Trendnet's firmware... then I couldn't login to the router. Exchanged it for same model. WIFI was still a problem and couldn't get any help from Trendnet. Temporarily went back to my 633, and returned the second TEW-812.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Stegath

customer_reviews.title: OKAY, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to set up, but very difficult for the USB port. Still haven't figured out how to access it on the network, and the very pagey owner's manual barely glosses over the SAMBA stuff. Also, this has half the range my DIR-880L had. Also that router showed the USB port just fine. On the plus side, this router is very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Beaumix

customer_reviews.title: At first it worked great but after a couple of days connections to our ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. At first it worked great but after a couple of days connections to our Android phones dropped. My wife works from home and she couldn't log onto company servers. It came down to an invalid DNS address. Even when we set it to static, she couldn't log on nor did our phones connect. I will be returning this product. I don't have hours to devote to troubleshooting and re configuring a router. Ended up hooking up my 5 year old Linksys and everything went back to normal. VERY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible router. Uplink transfer maxes out at around 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible router. Uplink transfer maxes out at around 2 Mbps, frequent disconnects, loses sync with cable modem and WAN segment goes to a loopback IP address. Have to reboot the router multiple times to correct the problem. It is 10 times worse than the Linksys E1550 that this router was supposed to replace which gives a 5Mbps uplink that my package provides. Will be returning this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Aamir Syed

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Definite improvement over the Dlink I had. There is way too much technical stuff involved in all this for me ... and I'm a simple, basic internet user ... watching episodes online is as "intense" as I get, so I imagine my "needs" are very different from a serious gamer. I feel my real issue are with my internet provider ... which seems to frequently "go down." I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ArtistDame1

customer_reviews.title: Love this router.
customer_reviews.text: This router works great. It resolved a problem I was having getting Netflix to work with my Amazon Fire TV. It was reasonably easy to set up and I am in no way savvy when it comes to technology. We use WiFi for two laptops, two smartphones, our television, an Xbox, and a Kindle Fire, and we have no connection problems and the speed is great. I researched routers before I bought this one and it got great reviews. The reviews were well-deserved.
customer_reviews.author: Spiritwitch

customer_reviews.title: Best router I've bought
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a 2tb Apple time capsule with this, the time capsule was just not very strong and I got sick of how difficult it would behave with non apple devices (never worked well with my xbox no matter what I did) Anyways this router is amazing, Even though the other routers I have had been rated for 300+mbps with 2.4 ghz, this is the first one where its actually tested higher then 30. Great range and throughput. Would buy again and recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: C.O.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. Was going to buy a much more expensive router and a friend recommended this one as more that capable. It was! Home wireless network is fast, stable, and has great range. Setup was quick and easy. Shipping was super fast, as usual, with Amazon Prime. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R&D

customer_reviews.title: I have never left an amazon review-until now. Purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: I have never left an amazon review-until now. Purchased a low key router and immediately experienced a speed drop from the comcast router/modem (dropped from 80 down to 50 down). Debated this purchase secondary to the price-I paid over $200 for the Asus modem/Trendnet combo, but WOW. Immediately I'm up to the max speed offered by comcast and hitting downloads >112mbs. If you looking for a new router and are on the fence I hope this pushes you over the edge.
customer_reviews.author: cutlerman

customer_reviews.title: Great Uptime, poor GUI
customer_reviews.text: Like every router but the Apple Time Capsule and Airport, this GUI sucks and is a pain. Not the worst, but still a a pain. The uptime has been great for a month, though. No crashes, network issues, or port forwarding problems. I only have 802.11n devices, so I can't vouch for ac speeds, but the wired speeds were perfect. no issues. I got this for $90, and it was a good deal. I'd buy it again, but that GUI is a pain to deal with! If you want simplicity in a GUI, use the apple airport.
customer_reviews.author: Expecting What I Pay For

customer_reviews.title: On my third tech support call
customer_reviews.text: I set this up like any other router I have owned and it never has worked properly. It continually stops working and has to be unplugged to start working again. Tech support is difficult to work with, as the two folks I spoke to were very hard to understand. I'm about to throw the thing in the trash. NOT worth the money
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very fast router. Router configuration page not as intuitive as others. Good range. As others said, 5ghz band range not as good as the 2.4 band. I use the 2.4 band for my far away devices and 5ghz band for closer ones. So far so good. Faster than my N router.
customer_reviews.author: TimTime

customer_reviews.title: I love it, wife hates it!
customer_reviews.text: Why you may ask. Well, it's because the 5GHz wi-fi has worked flawlessly since purchase and that's what I use. The 2.4GHz though is a different matter. For whatever reason it drops the internet connection on a regular basis - connected to the router but not the internet. This only effects the 2.4GHz channel and requires a router reset - soft/hard - to resolve. This is a colossal PITA and spoils what is, on the face of it, a damn good router.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S

customer_reviews.title: It might be a really awesome router, but to me a router is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to do the job. It might be a really awesome router, but to me a router is a router. If it lasts longer than 2 years, then I might up the rating (if I remember to). I am not too worried about the technical details on a router. Software to setup the 2 different networks 2.4 and 5 GHZ was just a bit confusing but I figured it out after a minute or two. Other features seem pretty easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: James H.

customer_reviews.title: Broken RESET button
customer_reviews.text: So this router came to me with a broken RESET button and cheap install software that required a hard reset if you make a mistake setting it up. Im assuming Im not the only one that wants to make changes after they set up the router. Needless to say without that magical tiny button this router is a paper weight. Either ship something out that works OR add software to make changes to the router that don't require a hard reset. Terrible product. Good luck everyone that bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: Nice router; poor call quality when using Wi-Fi calling
customer_reviews.text: Excellent WAN and wireless performance. Configuration screens could be easier to deal with, especially regarding secondary and tertiary SSIDs (which most people won't use). The only "issue" I have with this device is call quality when using Wi-Fi calling with our cell phones - it's horrendously bad and we no longer use the feature (luckily, this wasn't a "must have" for us).
customer_reviews.author: Geek1208

customer_reviews.title: I can't recommend this router enough
customer_reviews.text: With the most recent version of the DD-WRT firmware, this router is rock solid. I uses it as a VPN endpoint and it's wifi never drops, once you tune the settings. Over voltaging the wifi to 1watt greatly increases the range! I'm currently only using N, as I don't have any AC devices yet. I can't recommend this router enough, if you aren't afraid of DD-WRT advanced wifi config, then you'll find this router to be your best friend.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Vine

customer_reviews.title: Initial speed ok, but continual problems with maintaining wireless connections was a dealbreaker
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work well for me - kept disconnecting many of my devices at home (iPad, Macbook Air and iPhone 5S) for 20-30 seconds at a time before reconnecting. I tried a number of troubleshooting methods, but ended up returning it for a different product
customer_reviews.author: Paul Howard

customer_reviews.title: Easier than expected
customer_reviews.text: I plugged it in and that was it. The default setting found my DHCP server and immediately had Internet connectivity. I entered the password and was running at an amazing 450MB/s. The signal strength is about the same as my previous router, but the speed is lightning quick in comparison. Set it up as my own network name and it still had the original name available. You can access it as either with the two different passwords. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H

customer_reviews.title: Wicked fast but no range
customer_reviews.text: Wicked fast. I am dissatisfied with the wireless range. This router doesn't have the range needed for a typical home user's network. I could fine no settings to boost the range at all. When in range streaming and data transfer is seamless. My daughter who sometimes uses our system in her online transcription business can no longer work from the family room since this router is invisible from there.
customer_reviews.author: George Hoos

product_meta.title: TRENDnet Wireless AC1750 Dual Band Gigabit Router with USB 3.0 Share Port, Pre-Encrypted, TEW-812DRU
product_meta.description:
Capacity:AC1750

TRENDNET WIRELESS AC1750 DUAL BAND GIGABIT ROUTER WITH USB SHARE PORT, TEW-812DRU VERSION 2.1
Box ImageView larger 
Designed to produce the ultimate wireless experience in a busy connected home, TRENDnet’s AC1750 Dual Band Wireless Router, model TEW-812DRU, creates two concurrent wireless networks—a 1.3 Gigabit Wireless AC network and a 450 Mbps Wireless N network to connect common wireless devices. Use the high speed USB 3.0 port and Gigabit Ethernet ports to further expand your network.



DISCOVER THE POTENTIAL OF WIRELESS AC
Wireless AC is the next generation for wireless devices. Utilizing the 802.11ac standard and developed to stream high definition video, transfer large digital files and move data along at blazing fast speeds, Wireless AC is the wave of the future! Features 1750 Mbps total wireless: 1300 Mbps AC + 450 Mbps N bands High speed USB 3.0 share port Pre-encrypted for your security Create an isolated guest network One touch network connection with the WPS button All Gigabit wired ports High power amplifiers extend wireless coverage Compatible with DD-WRT open source firmware 802.11ac provides uninterrupted HD video streaming in a busy connected home Targeted Beamforming increases real-time performance by directing stronger wireless to your specific location Get up and running in minutes with the intuitive guided setup Parental Controls limit access to specific websites 

Maximum wireless signal rates are referenced from IEEE 802.11 theoretical specifications. Actual data throughput and coverage will vary depending on interference, network traffic, building materials and other conditions

FEATURES
 * 1750 Mbps total wireless: 1300 Mbps AC + 450 Mbps N bands 
 * High speed USB 3.0 share port 
 * Pre-encrypted for your security 
 * Create an isolated guest network 
 * One touch network connection with the WPS button 
 * All Gigabit wired ports 
 * High power amplifiers extend wireless coverage 
 * Compatible with DD-WRT open source firmware 
 * 802.11ac provides uninterrupted HD video streaming in a busy connected home 
 * Targeted Beamforming increases real-time performance by directing stronger wireless to your specific location 
 * Get up and running in minutes with the intuitive guided setup 
 * Parental Controls limit access to specific websites

Product ImageView larger 
Product ComparisonAC1900 Dual Band Wireless RouterView largerTEW-818DRUAC1200 Dual Band Wireless RouterView largerTEW-813DRUAC1750 Dual Band Wireless RouterView largerTEW-812DRUAC1200 Dual Band Wireless RouterView largerTEW-811DRUAC750 Dual Band Wireless RouterView largerTEW-810DR1300Mbps Wireless AC✓✓867Mbps Wireless AC✓✓433Mbps Wireless AC✓600Mbps Wireless N✓450Mbps Wireless N✓300Mbps Wireless N✓✓✓USB 3.0✓✓✓DD-WRT Compatible✓✓✓ 

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: 1750 Mbps total wireless: 1300 Mbps AC + 450 Mbps N bands
High speed USB 3.0 share port. Please note: Product is a Router only - modem not included.
One touch network connection with the WPS button
